import React from 'react'; import './ReceiveDiagnosis.css'; const ReceiveDiagnosis = () => { return (

Receive Diagnosis

For individuals who are blind in New York, embarking on the road to independence often starts with establishing contact with New York State Commission for the Blind (NYSCB).

The first step in accessing services from NYSCB typically involves submitting diagnostic results or proof of legal blindness, which can be obtained through schools, medical professionals, private agencies for the blind, or other community, health, or social service organizations.

To initiate this journey towards independence, obtaining a prescription from an eye clinic or hospital following an eye examination by a licensed ophthalmologist is necessary. The professional will officially diagnose "legal blindness".

Listen to Kadija's story:

You can obtain an eye examination from various institutions. Here are the instructions on how to locate them:

  • Medical Institutions and Ophthalmologists:

    Many medical institutions and ophthalmologists can provide proof of legal blindness. You can contact your ophthalmologist or nearby eye clinics to inquire if they offer such services. Here are some examples:

    • • New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai
    • • Weill Cornell Medicine Ophthalmology
    • • Columbia University Irving Medical Center - Ophthalmology
); }; export default ReceiveDiagnosis;
